questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar is using products and price books.
Which two items should an administrator take into considerations about these features? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The standard and list price for a product can be listed in more than one currency.
choices.C: If price books contain assets, they can NOT contain products.
choices.B: A product can have a different list price in different price books.
choices.D: Products without a price are automatically added to the standard price book.

discussion.content: A and B is the correct answer
It's asking to choose two. And Idk why, but i'll choose B and D

comments.content:

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar customers are starting to request custom-sized solar panels, which are currently unavailable in the standard inventory. Management has decided to add custom sizing as an add-on item in Salesforce.
The administrator needs to allow sales users to add custom sizing to the total opportunity sale.
What should the administrator do to achieve this goal?

discussion.content: Why the questions asks to 1 only?

Selected Answer: ABD
A. Account
B. Contacts
D. Opportunities

During the lead conversion process in Salesforce, you can map a custom lead field to the following objects:

A. Account
B. Contacts
D. Opportunities

This mapping allows data from custom lead fields to flow into corresponding fields on these objects when a lead is converted. So, the correct options are A, B, and D.

questions.question_text: You can map a custom lead field to only one of the following objects at a single instance? (Choose all that apply.)

Ursa Major Solar recently enabled the multiple currencies feature.
As a result, which currency will be used as the foundation for all currency conversion rates?

discussion.content: corporate currency is the right answer. why so many wrong answers on here?

The administrator sets the “corporate currency,” which reflects the currency of the corporate headquarters. The administrator also maintains the list of active currencies and their conversion rates relative to the corporate currency.
A lot of currencies can be active? but all of the will be converted from corporate
